metadata.description: specify the region for where the complete solution will deploy

1.core solution will launch the ams core components 2.core solution with monitoring will launch the core components with monitoring 3.core and hardening will launch the high availability solution 4.core and hardening with monitoring will launch the high avialabity solution with monitoring

if you select core and hardening or core and hardening with monitoring specify the desaster recovery region for webapps and azure sqlserver,cosmos Db desaster recovary it should be different of resource group region
The admin user of the SQL Server
The password of the admin user of the SQL Server
Describes Web Site name which should be unique
Describes Web Site name which should be unique for recovery app
Subscription ID of your Azure AD tenant
Tenant ID of Azure AD
Client ID of Azure AD application
Secret Key of Azure AD application
Describes B2C Tenant Name Directory
Describes the client Id registered with B2C Directory
Describes the B2C Sign Up-Sign In policy
Describes the B2C redirect URL for the Native Client
if you select costing model 4 specify b2cNativeRedirectURL describes the B2C redirect URL for the Native Client of disaster recovery web application
Existing Key Vault name with an access policy to allow Microsoft.Web RP to read Key Vault secrets
Name of the app service certificate for frontend webApp
Name of the app service certificate for apiserver
Name of the app service certificate for nodeserver

resources.name: DocumentDBGeo
resources.condition: [or(equals(parameters('solutionType'),'core and hardening'), equals(parameters('solutionType'),'core and hardening with monitoring'))]

resources.condition: [or(equals(parameters('solutionType'),'core and hardening'), equals(parameters('solutionType'),'core and hardening with monitoring'))]

azureSqlPassword.value: Enter the sqlAdministratorLoginPassword which you have enetered in parameter section while deploying the template.
